inlineContent.text: Learn what Apple defines as a “good widget” and
the 3 core principles of HIG.
Glanceable
This is the most important principle of widgets.
Users should be able to get key information with just a glance,
without pressing buttons or navigating complex UI.
Show information appropriate to the time, location, and user’s context.
Display today’s forecast in the morning and tomorrow’s forecast in the evening.
Relevant
Let users customize widgets through App Intent Configuration.
You can offer city selection, display units (°C/°F), background styles, and more.
Personalized
Apple defines widgets not as “mini apps” but as
projections of an app’s key information onto the Home Screen
Users look at their Home Screen over 90 times a day on average,
but spend only a few seconds each time.
Small (169×169pt)
: 4 pieces of information or fewer, single deep link.
“Current temperature + city name + weather icon + high/low” is about right.
Medium (360×169pt)
: Multiple deep links possible.
“Current weather + 5 hourly forecasts” or additional details.
Large (360×376pt)
: Rich information.
Can display “current + hourly + weekly forecast” all together.
Lock Screen (accessory)
: Extremely concise.
“Icon + temperature” level. Colors are controlled by the system.
HIG recommends
different layouts and information density
for each widget size.
Don’t simply scale the same view up or down.
According to Apple HIG, what is the most important design principle for widgets?
Widgets are not mini apps. They need to deliver key information within seconds.
Glanceable — Information should be understood at a glance
Readability is more important than information density. Show only appropriate information for the size.
Display as much information as possible
Widgets are not mini apps. Their purpose is to project key information.
Provide the same interactions as the app
What is the recommended maximum number of pieces of information for a Small widget?
Small widgets are only the size of 4 Home Screen icons,
so limiting information to 4 pieces or fewer is recommended.
4 or fewer
Small widgets have very limited space. 4 or fewer is recommended.
No limit
8 is too many. 4 or fewer is appropriate for Small widgets.
8 or fewer
